result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Bemus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Agent to determine level of employment that is appropriate, commensurate with his AODA and mental health needs.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   

No contact with Kwik Trip or Flying J, or their employees.  

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If agent requests, he/she may have access to the competency evaluation prepared for this case, to be kept confidential and not to be released without defendant's written consent.

records.addlTxt: Order to Modify Funds Due - Deceased

ADDRESS INFO for Donald J Bemus
Current: 300 N. Central Ave., Marshfield, WI 54449 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2016)
Prior: 103 Fillmore Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615
DNA submission form.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Osborne.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  $19.86 restitution requested.  Plead guilty to Counts 1 and 2 as charged.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charges he is pleading to.  He understood.  Priors confirmed by the court.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged.  State recommended probation, 2 years concurrent.  CC,  DNA sample and surcharge.  No contact with Kwik Trip or Flying J.  Pay restitution within 30 day of release from jail.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Comply with CGIP.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  If agent requests, he/she may have access to the competency evaluation prepared for this case.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Defense agrees with the State's recommendation.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation. Concurrent.   CC,  DNA sample and surcharges.  No contact with Kwik Trip or Flying J, or their employees.  Pay restitution $19.86, plus surcharge.  Agent to determine level of employment that is appropriate, commensurate with his AODA and mental health needs.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  If agent requests, he/she may have access to the competency evaluation prepared for this case, to be kept confidential and not to be released without defendant's written consent.
Restitution worksheet.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 10:00 am

Pre-trial conference at 02-17-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm.
Reading of the complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute to the charges.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 2/17 and STC 2/22 at 3 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, and with Attorney Osborne.  State agrees with the opinion of the examining physician's report.  Defense does not agree.  Dr. P. called.  Sworn, testifies by telephone.  State questioned the doctor.  Doctor's opinion has not changed.  Attorney Osborne questioned the doctor.  No redirect by the State.  State argued for finding of competency.  Attorney Osborne argued for finding of incompetency.  Court found defendant competent.
Copies sent to DA and defense attorney.  E-mailed to Judge
Faxed to WFU on 12-28 and copies to defendant, defense counsel, and DA on 12-29
Competency hearing at 02-12-2016 01:30 pm
Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with attorney Stephanie Osborne present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.

No reporter - hearing was recorded.  Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel Stephanie Osborne present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Osborne is requesting a competency evaluation.  CC Rewald states the Order will be prepared for the Court to sign upon her return.  AIA will be scheduled at a later date.
from Attorney Osborne
